name: Claimoh Solais
shortDescription: Sword of Light that shines with the brilliance of the sun and ensures victory in battle
fullDescription: The Claimoh Solais (Irish: Sword of Light) is one of the Four Treasures of the Tuatha De Danann, brought from the mystical city of Gorias. This radiant blade was wielded by Nuada Airgetlam and later by Lugh Lamfada. When drawn from its scabbard, it shone with the brilliance of the sun, and no enemy could stand against it. It represents divine authority, solar power, and the principle of righteous combat.

mythologyContexts.usage: Symbol of rightful kingship and divine authority in battle. Used by the leaders of the Tuatha De Danann to defend Ireland against invasions and establish cosmic order

textReferences.context: Lists the Sword of Light as one of the Four Treasures from Gorias

textReferences.passage: The Second Battle of Mag Tuired
textReferences.context: The sword is wielded in the great battle against the Fomorians

mythologyContexts.symbolism: Represents the solar principle, enlightenment, divine justice, and the cutting away of ignorance. The sword's light symbolizes truth that dispels darkness and the power of righteousness that cannot be overcome by evil or chaos.
mythologyContexts.culturalSignificance: The Sword of Light archetype permeates Celtic and later European mythology, influencing tales of Excalibur and other magical swords. It embodies the Celtic ideal of the warrior-king who rules through both martial prowess and divine sanction.
